subject: Olympic Games
lead_paragraph: Anita DeFrantz finished a distant last yesterday in an election for a seat on the International Olympic Committee’s executive board, leaving the United States again without a seat on the Olympics’ most influential body.“We unfortunately are still in the least-favored nation status,” she said. DeFrantz, a former Olympic rower, received six votes in an election won by the incumbent, Gerhard Heiberg of Norway, with 49 votes. The United States has been without representation on the executive body since Jim Easton lost his seat in elections in February 2006.
